storyInfo: The party finds an Arts amplification device set up by Gertrude in the concert hall. Gertrude herself appears, and after unsuccessfully trying to persuade Ebenholz, decides to take matters into her own hands.

attributes.content: He's not here?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Mein Herr stepped out a while ago.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: He left?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: He's off to the hospital just outside the Afterglow, to talk treatment for the Infected who got poisoned.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: What's this, Mein Herr? The hospital––
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: I managed to twist the arms of the largest two and got them to sign contracts, but as for the rest... there's no hope.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But Rhodes Island signed an agreement with those hospitals!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Oh, I didn't notice you were here as well.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: There's no point. Rhodes Island's contracts are limited to symptoms caused by Oripathy itself. They have ample grounds to not treat Infected patients who've fallen ill from poisoning.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But, Mein Herr, you got those two hospitals. That should be enough, right?
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Hmph. Enough? Of course it's enough! I put every copyright I hold down as collateral, of course the consortium behind them thinks that's enough!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Don't tell me you– You transferred all your copyrights over to that consortium?!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I did. Not just the existing copyrights. I even sold the distribution rights for tomorrow's concert to them.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Now, I can start from scratch... *cough*, *cough*.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: *cough*... *cough*!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Mein Herr?!
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: You're awake?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Urgh... Mhm...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Mr. Czerny, you didn't take any precautionary measures when you went out, did you?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You're talking about the fumes from those Originium slugs? I didn't waste a single second getting those contracts signed. That's all that mattered to me when I left.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Promise me you'll never be that reckless ever again.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: 'Ever again?' Are you saying, I still have time left to live?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That's why I'm here.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Heh. You never want to see a doctor until your body gives out on you.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Thank you, Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I'm just doing my job.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: That reminds me, why haven't you said anything, Ebenholz? Are you thinking of throwing in the towel now that the Afterglow is too dangerous?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I'll tell you straight– now that we've come this far, the concert MUST go on. Don't even think about running.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Don't even think about running, huh...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Whispers) Do you think he'd accept it now?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Whispers) Give it a moment...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Seems like you're not here to tell me you're quitting the concert?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: No, I'm not here to tell you I'm quitting the concert.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz, you repeat what others say when you get nervous. I've noticed it from the very beginning.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: If you have something to say, just spit it out. You think there's anything I wouldn't be able to accept in the state I'm in now?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: *cough* –– *cough* *cough* *cough*!!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Mr. Czerny, here, water!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough* *cough*... Damn–– damn that Gertrude!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: And you! How could you possibly go along with a plan like that? Curse me for thinking you had some creative talent, and this is what you use it for? Some evil plot?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: It wasn't my intention––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: How could it not be? Haven't you answered to that crazy woman from the very beginning?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Czerny, I still remember what you said. Even deeply-rooted hatred can still be pure music as long as it is expressed with the right technique.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I did say that, but what comes next? What are you trying to express?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: To be honest, I'm already starting to find my old way of thinking quite laughable.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But what I wish to pursue... is nothing more than freedom.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ––Freedom. A longing for freedom, is it?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You've got a long way to go before you can express that using music!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: This has long been a deeply-rooted experience for me. Otherwise, I would not have come to you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Come now.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Where are we going?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Where else? The concert hall.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Gertrude managed to keep me out of the lounge with her little tricks last time, but we're going to get to the bottom of this.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But, your health...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Instead of sitting here popping blood vessels over him and that woman, I might as well go see what they're up to.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Ebenholz, did Gertrude ever tell you if she did anything to the lounge?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: She didn't say anything.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: She doesn't have to say anything.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You can already tell?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Her fingerprints are all over this place...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: See that speaker right there? It shows obvious signs of having been dismantled. The same goes for the record player over there. She didn't even bother to tighten the screws–– Tsk, even the screwdriver's been left out in the open.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Just the kind of handiwork I'd expect from a noble. Hilarious.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Hibiscus, bring that record player over. Let's see what else has been tampered with besides the tonearm.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: See for yourself.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Did she just install an amplifier? That's only going to cause interference between the circuits...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: She already had the stylus removed. This thing's basically just an amplifier now.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Same with the speaker. The input circuit was completely removed and replaced with an amplifier... What is she trying to do putting so many amplifiers in the lounge?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: She never mentioned it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then let's give it a try. Go up on stage and play something. That'll be the fastest way to get our answer.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Doesn't seem like anything unusual is happening?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I can't hear anything out of the ordinary either.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Go over and tell Ebenholz to apply a little bit of Arts... Only the simplest kind to disperse drowsiness, maintained strictly at the lowest level.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough* *cough*, *cough*––
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Czerny!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Don't worry about me... I just, got some palpitations, that's all...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Ebenholz, stand over here, and try using the same Arts as before. Remember to mind the volume.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: An echo?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: It's a sound coming from outside.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But isn't it the sound of Ebenholz's flute?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Czerny opens his mouth, but no voice comes out.
The answer already seems clear to him.
However, the expression Hibiscus sees on his face is not one of excitement or anger, but of terror.
Pure terror.
Gertrude converted this lounge, no, the entire Afterglow Hall, into a massive amplifier – an Arts amplification device.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: The amplifier stays off as long as it doesn't detect any musical Arts.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But as soon as someone casts musical Arts, the amplification device activates... and exponentially amplifies the Arts as the music spreads through Afterglow Hall.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: The leakages and Resonanz of the Voice of Mundane... are no exception.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: (Stares vacantly)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: In other words, Originium activation will spike in all areas that are affected, meaning that everyone in Vyseheim, virtually without exception, will be infected...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: And those who already have Oripathy are even less likely to be spared. After they die, their bodies will rapidly disintegrate, releasing a large amount of active Originium microparticles...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: The surrounding area will be permanently poisoned, and Vyseheim will be completely cut off from the outside world––
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Very sorry to interrupt your little chat, but I'm here to offer a suggestion.
Why cast Arts of wakefulness across all of Vyseheim on such a beautiful night? I often suffer from insomnia.
My apologies, but we're dealing with something very important right now...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Gertrude?!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Good evening, Czerny.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: And this must be Operator Hibiscus from Rhodes Island, yes? 'tis a pleasure to meet you.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: As for the young man in shock over there, why not come visit my home for something to drink? Perhaps have a nice night's rest, and return energized tomorrow?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Ger... Gertrude... To think you'd actually––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'd actually what? Don't tell me you're going to say that I'd actually deceive you and make you murder half the city?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: That can't be right.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: What you're actually mad about is how I had you running in circles, and nearly got you killed without you even noticing. Right?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Show us your pride as a noble, Graf Urtica. Come on, say something.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Ebenholz, she's trying to provoke you.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: There's only one thing I need to know from you right now: Why did you come here?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I came because you woke me up, why else?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'll take that as, you heard the musical Arts rippling outwards and realized your plans had been discovered.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: That's correct.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Ahh, what a pity. With just one more day, I would've enjoyed a complete success.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Don't you think you should be thinking about how to escape? Do you seriously think your plan will proceed as normal if you manage to take us out here?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Ebenholz won't help you anymore, and regardless of what you were planning for the duet, it's not going to happen now!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Really? That's not how I see it.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: As long as Ebenholz and Kreide are here, my plan has not failed.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: As long as I eliminate you, I can continue negotiating with Graf Urtica. He is quite familiar with the art of the noble dealings, and changing his mind is hardly an impossibility.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Most importantly, I don't think you lot can actually beat me.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: If the three of you were equal in power to Graf Urtica, then I certainly would have to watch my step. But you three, aha... Pardon my rudeness.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Don't waste your breath.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Graf Urtica, why don't we both take a step back? What do you say?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Take a step back?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I dismantle these giant amplifiers, and you continue working with me. That way, only Kreide has to die. Not a bad deal considering he only has a few days to live anyway, right?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: In your dreams.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That truly is a shame. Due to unfortunate circumstances, you were forced to choose the path most ill-suited for you.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: If that is your heart's desire, then so be it. What a shame––
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Shut up...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You'll regret this for the rest of your life.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I said, shut up!!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The time for talk is over. It seems we can only settle this with a fight.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: If I win, the self-appointed guardians of the Afterglow will have to behave themselves and keep their mouths shut so I can continue negotiating with Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: If you win, then there's nothing more to say. A win is a win.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Take your wand out, Graf Urtica. Or do you plan to have those two Infected fight for you?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Like I said, your provocations won't get you anywhere.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Hibiscus, stay out of this. Today, I swear I'll––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Think carefully about where we are, and what's all around us!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Unless you're able to do this without any musical Arts, you'll drive all the inhabitants of Vyseheim insane before the disease ever comes!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Tsk tsk. You're a quick thinker, Fräulein Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Since you caught on so quickly, I suppose there's no other choice but to take it outside.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Let me get this out there first. Rid yourself of the notion that escape counts as victory. While I personally dislike roughing up innocent bystanders, I can't say the same for my underlings.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You must not have a whole lot of confidence in yourself, based on how many you brought with you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm so glad to hear your sharp wit once more. I'm almost moved to tears.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Are you feeling better now, Graf Urtica?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Of course, Dame Strollo.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let's head outside and fight to our hearts' content.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: There must be nobody for you to spar with back in Urtica. Should be lonely, right?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: If I did, I wouldn't be playing with an old bag like you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: After all, you've never even challenged your own brother for his title. You have to wait for him to die before you can move up. I'm guessing you've never bested him in a fight before.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Very good, very good. I'm starting to hate you more and more.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: The feeling is mutual.
attributes.name: Ebenholz
